content.description: A low crux mantle and a few more thoughtful slabby moves give way to more moderate climbing above.
content.location: Bolted route between Sorry and Chutes and Ladders

content.description: This route seems harder and headier than it should for the grade.  Bolts feel like they are placed in the middle of cruxes.
content.protection: Bolts to chain anchors.  Shares anchors with Corner.
content.location: This route is at the left-most side of Candy Land wall.  It is left of the boulder pile separating it from the bulk of the Candy Land routes.

content.description: Really fun route with a low crux at bolt 1.  Balance and foot work makes this feel much easier than the original topo grade of 5.10- compared to other routes on the ranch.  Climb is cruxy until the cave, where you get a nice rest and moderate climbing to the end.
content.protection: 6 bolts plus a two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Fourth route (left to right) on the main Candy Land Wall.  Bolt line goes up through the right side of the cave.

content.description: Belay from the boulder, left most climb on the main Candy Land Wall.  Well protected slab climb with a a loose horizontal flake between bolts 3 and 4.  Pull down not out!  Can be easily avoided.
content.protection: 5 bolts, plus 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Left most route at Candy Land. Belay from boulder on the left side of the wall.

content.description: Belay from the ground.  Slab climbing with a low bulging dihedral start (crux). Line of bolts 5 to 7 ft left of big cave.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Second line (left to right) on main Candy Land Wall.

content.description: Dihedral climb with crux up high in the pockety section.
content.protection: Bolts to Chain Anchors. Shares anchors with Ten-D-nitis.
content.location: This route is on Candy Land wall.  It is left of the boulder pile separating it from the bulk of the Candy Land routes.

content.description: Climb the huge flake on the right side of the wall, stand on it and climb to the top.  Belayer beware!  The right side is not a place to congregate under this flake.  While it has been climbed many times, be mindful of the rope as you lead so as not to get it caught behind the flake and be mindful of where you stand in relation to the flake.  Be mindful as you lower so as not to allow the rope behind the flake.  Rock quality down low is chossy and feet may blow going to bolt 1.
content.protection: 5-6 bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Right most climb on the main Candy Land wall.  Climb the obvious flake.

content.description: Fun slab climb that uses the left side of the cave.  Run-out between bolts 3 and 4 on easier terrain.  A good mental test for the grade.
content.protection: 5 bolts, plus 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Third climb (left to right) on main Candy Land Wall.  Bolt line that goes up the left side of cave.

content.description: Candy Land is a popular warm up area with technical slabs and anchors easily accessible from the top.  Delicate footwork makes these climbs more thoughtful than strenuous.   Candy Land gets morning shade and has 5 main routes with 2 auxiliary routes on the left side of the boulder field.  Don't miss the ground school anchors on your way to the wall on a boulder just to the left as you approach the wall from The Butt.
